fields.summary: Monitor fair-scheduler.xml and automatically update/validate jobs submitted to fair-scheduler

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.
status.name: Reopened

fields.description:
Following unit tests failed with same stack:
org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.plugin.TestHiveAuthorizerCheckInvocation
org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.plugin.TestHiveAuthorizerShowFilters
{noformat}
2017-01-11T15:02:27,774 ERROR [main] ql.Driver: FAILED: NullPointerException null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.fair.QueuePlacementRule.cleanName(QueuePlacementRule.java:351)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.fair.QueuePlacementRule$User.getQueueForApp(QueuePlacementRule.java:132)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.fair.QueuePlacementRule.assignAppToQueue(QueuePlacementRule.java:74)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.scheduler.fair.QueuePlacementPolicy.assignAppToQueue(QueuePlacementPolicy.java:167)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.schshim.FairSchedulerShim.setJobQueueForUserInternal(FairSchedulerShim.java:96)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.schshim.FairSchedulerShim.validateQueueConfiguration(FairSchedulerShim.java:82)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.session.YarnFairScheduling.validateYarnQueue(YarnFairScheduling.java:68)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.configureScheduling(Driver.java:671)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.compile(Driver.java:543)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.compileInternal(Driver.java:1313)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.runInternal(Driver.java:1453)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.run(Driver.java:1233)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.run(Driver.java:1223)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fix unit tests failures caused by HIVE-13696

comments.body:
1) Fix NPE by adding null value check 
2) Use HiveConf.getUser instead of userName variable.

The patch looks good. +1.

Seems we should have single place to have the username. Right now it's in multiple places.

On a live cluster where I'm running with hive.exec.engine=mr (yes, I know that's being deprecated out but it's useful for quick and dirty sanity testing), I get the following even with this patch, when I try to do a  "insert into t1 select * from demo.t1" into a new db where I'm trying to copy t1's data :

{noformat}
java.io.IOException: org.apache.hadoop.yarn.exceptions.YarnException: Failed to submit application_1477097284419_0047 to YARN : Application application_1477097284419_0047 submitted by user hive to unknown queue: root.hive
	at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.YARNRunner.submitJob(YARNRunner.java:306)

Job Submission failed with exception 'java.io.IOException(org.apache.hadoop.yarn.exceptions.YarnException: Failed to submit application_1477097284419_0047 to YARN : Application application_1477097284419_0047 submitted by user hive to unknown queue: root.hive)'
FAILED: Execution Error, return code 1 from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.mr.MapRedTask. org.apache.hadoop.yarn.exceptions.YarnException: Failed to submit application_1477097284419_0047 to YARN : Application application_1477097284419_0047 submitted by user hive to unknown queue: root.hive
{noformat}

Is some other queue configuration needed as part of the introduction of HIVE-13696?
Additional note : setting hive.server2.map.fair.scheduler.queue to false makes this work, but given that true is the default in HiveConf, the default hive tarball installation is broken currently.
[~sushanth], I agree with you, we need revert HIVE-13696 to make the tarball installation stable.
